# Satsuma Province

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Provinces_of_Japan-
Satsuma.svg/220px-Provinces_of_Japan-
Satsuma.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Provinces_of_Japan-Satsuma.svg)

[](/wiki/File:Provinces_of_Japan-Satsuma.svg "Enlarge")

Map of Japanese provinces (1868) with Satsuma Province highlighted

**Satsuma Province** (薩摩国, _Satsuma-no Kuni_) was an [old
province](/wiki/Old_provinces_of_Japan "Old provinces of Japan") of
[Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan") that is now the western half of [Kagoshima
Prefecture](/wiki/Kagoshima_Prefecture "Kagoshima Prefecture") on the island
of [Kyūshū](/wiki/Ky%C5%ABsh%C5%AB "Kyūshū").[1] Its abbreviation is Sasshū
(薩州).

## History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Satsuma_Province&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: History")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cb/Tea_Storage_Jar_with_Paulownia_and_Thunder_Pattern_LACMA_M.2007.130a-b.jpg/220px-
Tea_Storage_Jar_with_Paulownia_and_Thunder_Pattern_LACMA_M.2007.130a-b.jpg)](/wiki/File:Tea_Storage_Jar_with_Paulownia_and_Thunder_Pattern_LACMA_M.2007.130a-b.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Tea_Storage_Jar_with_Paulownia_and_Thunder_Pattern_LACMA_M.2007.130a-b.jpg
"Enlarge")

Satsuma earthenware tea storage jar (_chatsubo_) with paulownia and thunder
pattern, late Edo period, circa 1800-1850

Satsuma's provincial capital was
[Satsumasendai](/wiki/Satsumasendai,_Kagoshima "Satsumasendai, Kagoshima").
During the [Sengoku period](/wiki/Sengoku_period "Sengoku period"), Satsuma
was a [fief](/wiki/Fief "Fief") of the [Shimazu](/wiki/Shimazu_family "Shimazu
family") _[daimyō](/wiki/Daimy%C5%8D "Daimyō")_ , who ruled much of southern
Kyūshū from their [castle](/wiki/Kagoshima_Castle "Kagoshima Castle") at
[Kagoshima](/wiki/Kagoshima,_Kagoshima "Kagoshima, Kagoshima") city. They were
the initial patrons of [Satsuma ware](/wiki/Satsuma_ware "Satsuma ware"),
which was later widely exported to the West.

In 1871, with the [abolition of feudal
domains](/wiki/Abolition_of_the_han_system "Abolition of the han system") and
the establishment of [prefectures](/wiki/Prefectures "Prefectures") after the
[Meiji Restoration](/wiki/Meiji_Restoration "Meiji Restoration"), the
provinces of Satsuma and [Ōsumi](/wiki/%C5%8Csumi_Province "Ōsumi Province")
were combined to eventually establish Kagoshima Prefecture.

Satsuma was one of the main provinces that rose in opposition to the [Tokugawa
shogunate](/wiki/Tokugawa_shogunate "Tokugawa shogunate") in the mid 19th
century. Because of this, the [oligarchy](/wiki/Meiji_oligarchy "Meiji
oligarchy") that came into power after the [Meiji
Restoration](/wiki/Meiji_Restoration "Meiji Restoration") of 1868 had a strong
representation from the Satsuma province, with leaders such as [Ōkubo
Toshimichi](/wiki/%C5%8Ckubo_Toshimichi "Ōkubo Toshimichi") and [Saigō
Takamori](/wiki/Saig%C5%8D_Takamori "Saigō Takamori") taking up key government
positions.

Satsuma is well known for its production of [sweet
potatoes](/wiki/Sweet_potato "Sweet potato"), known in Japan as 薩摩芋 (satsuma-
imo or "Satsuma potato"). On the other hand, Satsuma mandarins (known as
[_mikan_](/wiki/Citrus_unshiu "Citrus unshiu") in Japan) do not specifically
originate from Satsuma but were imported into the West through this province
in the Meiji era.

## Historical
districts[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Satsuma_Province&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Historical districts")]

  * [Kagoshima Prefecture](/wiki/Kagoshima_Prefecture "Kagoshima Prefecture")
    * [Ata District](/w/index.php?title=Ata_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Ata District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (阿多郡) - merged into Hioki District on March 29, 1896
    * [Ei District](/w/index.php?title=Ei_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Ei District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (頴娃郡) - merged into Ibusuki District (along with parts of Kiire District) on March 29, 1896
    * [Hioki District](/wiki/Hioki_District,_Kagoshima "Hioki District, Kagoshima") (日置郡) - absorbed Ata District on March 29, 1896; now dissolved
    * [Ibusuki District](/wiki/Ibusuki_District,_Kagoshima "Ibusuki District, Kagoshima") (揖宿郡) - absorbed Ei and parts of Kiire Districts on March 29, 1896; now dissolved
    * [Isa District](/w/index.php?title=Isa_District,_Satsuma&action=edit&redlink=1 "Isa District, Satsuma \(page does not exist\)") (囎唹郡) 
      * [Kitaisa District](/w/index.php?title=Kitaisa_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Kitaisa District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (北伊佐郡) - merged with [Hishikari District](/w/index.php?title=Hishikari_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Hishikari District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (菱刈郡) of [Ōsumi Province](/wiki/%C5%8Csumi_Province "Ōsumi Province") to become the 2nd incarnation of [Isa District](/wiki/Isa_District,_Kagoshima "Isa District, Kagoshima") (伊佐郡) on March 29, 1896
      * [Minamiisa District](/w/index.php?title=Minamiisa_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Minamiisa District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (東囎唹郡) - merged into Satsuma District (along with Koshikijima and Taki Districts) on March 29, 1896
    * [Izaku District](/w/index.php?title=Izaku_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Izaku District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (伊作郡) - merged into Ata District prior the [Meiji period](/wiki/Meiji_period "Meiji period")
    * [Izumi District](/wiki/Izumi_District,_Kagoshima "Izumi District, Kagoshima") (出水郡)
    * [Kagoshima District](/wiki/Kagoshima_District,_Kagoshima "Kagoshima District, Kagoshima") (鹿児島郡) - absorbed [Kitaōsumi District](/w/index.php?title=Kita%C5%8Dsumi_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Kitaōsumi District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (北大隅郡) of Ōsumi Province and Taniyama District of Satsuma Province on March 29, 1896
    * [Kawanabe District](/wiki/Kawanabe_District,_Kagoshima "Kawanabe District, Kagoshima") (川辺郡) - absorbed remaining parts of Kiire District (the village of Chiran) on March 29, 1896; now dissolved
    * [Koshikijima District](/w/index.php?title=Koshikijima_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Koshikijima District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (甑島郡) - merged into Satsuma District (along with Minamiisa and Taki Districts) on March 29, 1896
    * [Kiire District](/w/index.php?title=Kiire_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Kiire District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (給黎郡) - split and merged into Kawanabe and Ibusuki Districts on March 29, 1896
    * [Satsuma District](/wiki/Satsuma_District,_Kagoshima "Satsuma District, Kagoshima") (薩摩郡) - absorbed Koshikijima, Minamiisa and Taki Districts on March 29, 1896
    * [Taki District](/w/index.php?title=Taki_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Taki District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (高城郡) - merged into Satsuma District (along with Koshikijima and Minamiisa Districts) on March 29, 1896
    * [Taniyama District](/w/index.php?title=Taniyama_District,_Kagoshima&action=edit&redlink=1 "Taniyama District, Kagoshima \(page does not exist\)") (谿山郡) - merged into Kagoshima District (along with Kitaōsumi District of Ōsumi Province) on March 29, 1896
